-= Kitchen =-
You have come into the most ordinary of all possible kitchens.

You can make out a fridge. You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to an oven. You make out a table. The table appears to be empty. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a table in a room. You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a sliced red hot pepper, a raw red potato, a black pepper, a cookbook and a knife. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it.

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
You have come into the most ordinary of all possible kitchens.

You can make out a fridge. You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to an oven. You make out a table. The table appears to be empty. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a table in a room. You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a sliced red hot pepper, a raw red potato, a black pepper, a cookbook and a knife. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it.

-= Kitchen =-
You have come into the most ordinary of all possible kitchens.

You can make out a fridge. You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to an oven. You make out a table. The table appears to be empty. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a table in a room. You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a sliced red hot pepper, a raw red potato, a black pepper, a cookbook and a knife. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it.

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
You have come into the most ordinary of all possible kitchens.

You can make out a fridge. You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to an oven. You make out a table. The table appears to be empty. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a table in a room. You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a sliced red hot pepper, a raw red potato, a black pepper, a cookbook and a knife. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it.

-= Kitchen =-
You have come into the most ordinary of all possible kitchens.

You can make out a fridge. You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to an oven. You make out a table. The table appears to be empty. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a table in a room. You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a sliced red hot pepper, a raw red potato, a black pepper, a cookbook and a knife. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it.

On the counter you see a sliced red hot pepper, a raw red potato, a black pepper, a cookbook and a knife. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it.

-= Kitchen =-
You have come into the most ordinary of all possible kitchens.

You can make out a fridge. You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to an oven. You make out a table. The table appears to be empty. You make a mental note to not get your hopes up the next time you see a table in a room. You scan the room for a counter, and you find a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a sliced red hot pepper, a raw red potato, a black pepper, a cookbook and a knife. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it.
